page.title: 12The Farm Museum
page.content: The farm was built in the original Domesday period.It was probably built on a moated site, in a figure of eight, in the eleventh century. It survived for about a hundred years. It was rebuilt nearby in the thirteenth century. The kitchen and dairy originate from that time. The kitchen used to be the great hall and has lancet windows. At that time the owners owned 300 acres. It was a mixed farm with mostly cattle and sheep. It is now a farm museum. It is an active farm with some animals and crops and uses methods used in the Edwardian period such as threshing. They have regular demonstrations of lacemaking, farmhouse cooking, milking cows and goats, sheep dipping, blacksmithing, steam engines, horse grooming, horse and cart rides, donkey rides, butter-making and many other ancient crafts.
